Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2012 10:40PM fmaury wrote: Hi LynnM, I just joined this group. I had a bilateral mastectomy on May 16 and have tissue expanders in. So far so good. I spent the first week at home with a portable "nerve block". A sort of epidural anesthetic that was annoying (2 bulbs that needed to be carried in little bags) but boy did it help with the pain! I was out and about and taking walks, cooking, working at the computer, etc. During that time I took antibiotics twice a day, 1-2 percocets at night and celebrex/tylenol during the day. I was also prescribed a low dose of valium 3 X day to relax the muscles. Finally, I was already taking gabapentin (Neurontin) for neck pain issues (which have disappeared since the surgery, go figure!) so I kept on taking that as well. Bottom line: the only time I was in real pain was the night the nerve block came out. But I took extra percocet that night and every day was better after that. The absence of serious pain has allowed me to do stretches (prescribed by physical therapist) and stay active. When I sit around all day, I can really feel the tightness at the end of the day. The lesson for me has been: don't be afraid of the drugs, they are part of the recovery process! Wishing everyone a prompt recovery! Caroline
